English:
The diagonal crossing in Shibuya is crawling with
monsters. Where am I supposed to go to hit on
women now?
Chinese:
涉谷站前的十字路口都是怪物……
這樣子根本就不是搭訕的時候了……
Korean:
시부야의 스크램블 교차점이 괴물 천지야…
이래선 헌팅할 상황도 아니겠네…
German:
Auf der Kreuzung in Shibuya wimmelt es nur so
von Monstern. Wo soll ich denn jetzt Frauen
aufreißen?

English:
Mom, what are they?! Animals?! Can I pet them?!
I want one for my birthday!
Chinese:
媽媽，那是什麼！？　動物！？
我也想摸摸！　生日禮物想要那個！
Korean:
엄마, 저거 뭐야~!? 동물!?
나도 만지고 싶어~! 생일선물로 저거 갖고 싶어!
German:
Mama, was sind das für Dinger?! Tiere?! Darf ich
sie streicheln?! Ich will eines zum Geburtstag!

English:
Absolutely not! But actually, some of them are
kinda cute. I might even think about taking one
home if they weren't so ferocious.
Chinese:
不、不行喔！　那個不行！
哎呀……但是好像也有可愛的呢。
如果不會太兇狠的話，要不要帶回家呢……
Korean:
아, 안 돼! 저건 안 돼!
어머…하지만 귀여운 것도 있는 모양이네.
사납지 않다면 데리고 갈까…
German:
Auf keinen Fall! Aber einige sind ganz niedlich.
Wenn sie nicht so wild wären, würde ich es mir
vielleicht überlegen.

English:
There was a big power outage in the city. I bet a
hacker was behind it. I don't know what they're up
to, but it's really annoying!
Chinese:
之前市內的大停電……好像是駭客做的喔。
真是的，真不曉得是在想些什麼，
真叫人困擾啊！
Korean:
요전에 일어난 도시 대정전…그거 해커의 짓이라는 듯해.
정말이지 무슨 생각인지는 모르겠지만
성가신 짓거리지!
German:
In der Stadt gab es einen großen Stromausfall.
Da steckt sicher ein Hacker dahinter. Ich weiß
nicht, was sie vorhaben, aber es nervt wirklich!

English:
What should I do if someone suspects me? I wouldn't
want my friends to end up hating me.
Chinese:
等等，如果被誰聽到的話怎麼辦啦！
我才不想要被他們的同伴給記恨啊。
Korean:
잠깐, 누가 들으면 어쩌려고!
동료한테서 괜한 원한을 사는 건 사양이야
German:
Was soll ich tun, wenn jemand mich verdächtigt?
Ich will nicht, dass meine Freunde mich hassen.

English:
All citizens, please calm down! Evacuate the area
in a reasonable and orderly manner!
Chinese:
避難請勿驚慌！
冷靜的採取行動！
Korean:
당황하지 말고, 조용하게 피난 부탁드립니다!
침착하게 행동해주세요!
German:
Bürger, bitte bewahren Sie Ruhe! Verlassen
Sie das Gebiet ruhig und geordnet!

English:
There are tall buildings everywhere! Are there
humans inside? How did they make them?
Chinese:
好多好大的建築物喔！
那個裡面也有很多人類嗎！？
那是用什麼作的啊？
Korean:
커다란 건물투성이네~!
저기 안에도 인간이 잔뜩 있는 거야~!?
어떻게 만든 거야~?
German:
Überall sind so hohe Gebäude! Sind da Menschen
drin? Wie haben sie die gebaut?

English:
I can walk along this track, but a big machine
comes along it sometimes. I'd better be careful.
Chinese:
聽說可以走在這個條紋上面過去喔。
但是有些時候，會有很大台的機械經過，
必須要小心才行。
Korean:
이 줄무늬 위라면 지나도 괜찮대~
하지만 가끔 커다란 기계가 지나가니까
조심해야 돼~
German:
Ich kann diesen Gleisen folgen, aber manchmal
kommt da eine große Maschine entlang. Ich sollte
vorsichtig sein.
